page.title: 08BASING HOUSE
page.content: Basing House On a hill in Basing are the ruins of Basing House.The first castle was built in Norman times. During the reign of Queen Elizabeth I, the house was rebuilt in red brick.It was the largest private house in England. It was owned by the Marquess of Winchester.During the Civil War, 1642-1645, Basing House was held for King Charles I.In the last year of the war, the house was bombarded by the Roundheads and overrun.The house was looted and then burnt down. At the ruins of Basing House there are a few dungeons, some very deep wells, cellars and extensive earthworks. It has a tunnel which is 100 metres long.We saw kitchens and an octagonal dovecote,where doves still reside.
